website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive and versatile cross-trainer for newbies or those with experience.
pros: Supportive upper design and breathable insole

customer_reviews.title: Bought them for the looks fell in love with the comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I thought at first they would bulky and hard on my feet, I work long hours, on my feet all day! I realized within minutes of wearing these shoes that my feet didn't hurt, my back didn't ache, my toes weren't numb anymore. I can't tell you how much a good pair of shoes are worth to your whole body! They have tremendous support, light weight even though they don't look it, and very comfortable! I'm in love with these shoes and plan to buy more each pay day. I recommend you do the same!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Niki's reviews

customer_reviews.title: I will be purchasing again
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. They are a great looking pair of shoes. I have such a hard time finding shoes that fit my feet. I have small feet with a narrow heel. These Puma's are perfect. They also help me get threw a work day without heel pain.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: New FAVORITE sneaker!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this shoe. It fits just right. I feel great support even with my prolapsed arches. Comfortable wearing all day and doing a lot of walking. The color is more of a charcoal gray. I absolutely love them! I wear a size 8 and ordered a size 8 and it fits perfectly! I will probably order another pair in another color! Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Ly

customer_reviews.title: Stiff, clunky, hard
customer_reviews.text: I am still wearing these for my fitness classes since I can't return them and in hopes that they will soften up and be less stiff. I have the following issues with them: - Imitation leather material is hard and hasn't broken in to conform to my foot; there is no give like with a fabric shoe. Also does not offer ventilation resulting in hot feet. - Outsole is hard and does not offer much cushion; insole has some memory foam but it is a thin layer. I may try insoles to improve the cushioning. - They feel clunky and thick; it seems like my toes/feet can't get a good read on the floor when doing, say, a STEP program.
customer_reviews.author: CalicoGal

customer_reviews.title: Wish I hadn't read the review #doesntrunsmall
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are so cute & so comfy.. after reading all the reviews saying the shoe runs small, I ordered a size up. I wish I hadn't because now they are a little big, I can still wear them and be comfortable but they do run true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Smith

customer_reviews.title: Holy Moly
customer_reviews.text: Wow 😍 I am in Love !!! Where do I even begin ?? Tried them on without socks straight out of the box and with new shoes you have to adjust the laces, fit like a glove ! Then a few days later tried them with socks and OMG, first they were tight but broke in pretty quick, these fit amazingly, the memory foam is wonderful, the perfect fit is what I'm needing for support and comfort as I have bruised tendons and severe problems with my Achilles in both feet, I'm just in love...I'm a size 9 with osteoarthritis and other health problems, I truly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: GINGAR

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for the Gym!  Secure and supportive!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to get me started at the gym. They took a wear or two to fit really well, but now they're absolutely perfect and comfortable. I can do a variety of activities and haven't yet had any foot soreness (and I am an obese woman working hard with a personal trainer-- I've definitely worked these shoes hard). They fit more snugly to the upper foot than I'm accustomed to, which felt odd at first, but is definitely good when I'm doing certain activities; my feet feel very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Great sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Love these sneakers! I've only worn them for a day, but I'm 9 months pregnant. So walking around in these for a day felt great! My feet didn't hurt or anything and I love the color! Best sneakers I've bought so far
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it’s true, order 1/2 size up.
customer_reviews.text: Idk if it’s a design flaw .... or memory foam issue, faux leather maybe? I’m truly a size 8 1/2 with a narrow foot, this shoe dug into my little toe. The right side more noticeable... I read reviews about ordering a 1/2 size up but most complaints were that it ran narrow. So they’re going back. It’s a cute design and I’m hoping better luck with a 9. Unfortunately unavailable from this same seller as they offered quick delivery at a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Christina A.

customer_reviews.title: I've bought this pair 3 times in 5 or 6 years!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a CNA, bartender, babysitter running after toddlers, each pair have seen a huge amount of wear and tear in the last 5 or 6 years and although although my 2nd pair are constantly worn still, I did buy a 3rd pair for "nicer" occassions because my last pair seen hell at my previous bartender job. From spills, cooking grease, and just plain old running none stop plus I was a CNA before that and we were short staffed so, talk about running!! And needless to say the "messes" you come across... I knew I wanted another pair before I needed them so of course, I bought them!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa E.

customer_reviews.title: Feet don’t hurt at the end of the day
customer_reviews.text: They fit comfortably and look great. I am on my feet for 8 hours+ straight and I can come home and still be on my feet not hurting.
customer_reviews.author: turtle

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for Working on your Feet
customer_reviews.text: I am a healthcare worker and purchased these for work-8h days on your feet at the hospital requires comfortable shoes that are also easy to wipe clean, and so far these are doing great! I have had these now about 2 weeks and I am very happy with them, especially the foam insole-it's so soft like walking on pillows. It hasn't sunken for me as of yet. The arch support is OK but not the main supportive factor-I have low arches and don't have arch pain to begin with, but I still find these shoes supportive. However, if you have arch issues, I would find a shoe with better medial support and arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Zeena

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The shoes themselves seemed fine, but sizing is frustrating. Based on reviews, I ordered a half size up. They were too small. I ordered the next half size up, (So I am normally a 10 and I started with a 10.5 and then went up to 11) and they were too big. I tried to tough it out but it caused too much pain. Since I bought them specifically for the gym and working out, comfort as well as durability was very important. I have never had such trouble with shoe sizing and the experience just reiterated my firm belief that shoes are something I will need to try on in person before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not meant for long time wear
customer_reviews.text: I work in retail so I’m on my feet 8hrs a day, this shoe is the worse thing ever..an hour into my shift and my feet are literally throbbing, there’s no arch support, the material isn’t flexible at all, it’s too narrow I feel like my toes will fall off..I bought these In June and didn’t get to wear them till November so the return window closed on me so I can’t get my $$ back Do yourself a favor n save your toes from the pain, these shoes are definitely not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Chinenye

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: When I first put them on I thought I purchased the wrong shoes since they really mimic indoor soccer shoes. They’re very stiff and feel artificial like man-made material. They are very hot and narrow so if your foot is wide in anyway get the wide model and they run very tight but supportive so I would probably go half a size up. I’m going to keep them because of the wonderful reviews but I’m not over the moon. I just walked 5 miles in them and they’re very sporty looking but they look ridiculous with a sock so definitely get no show socks.
customer_reviews.author: Tangled mess

customer_reviews.title: A steal!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Lightning Deal (hence $15 cheaper than listed). These shoes are true to size, snug but not tight .. hence, the support is good. I like the arch support too but I haven't worn them too long to know how the arch support holds up over time. The look and feel make them seem more expensive than they are. I like the colors and they haven't faded on wear. I've worked out at the gym in these, gone running and also just gone on walks & to run errands ... they are comfortable enough where you forget you have them on. Not bulky and contour around my foot so well you'd think they were custom made!
customer_reviews.author: Reena

customer_reviews.title: Not for working out
customer_reviews.text: I liked the looks of this shoe, but for cross-training.......No! These shoes are very very hot on your feet because they do not breathe their feet are basically encased in a heavy plastic material. Secondly, the cushioning is completely overstated by the seller. There is some lateral stability but the bottoms of these shoes are so stiff you might as well nail a piece of wood on the bottom of your feet because you will feel like you are running in wooden shoes. Absolutely a NO WAY for me. Pronators beware.
customer_reviews.author: jodi s Vinch

customer_reviews.title: Cute shoe but a little heavy than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -well made. -aesthetically pleasing. -great price point. -provides good amount of stability. Cons: -slightly bulky. -heavier than expected. -footwear tongue too thick. I wore this shoe to two different workouts: Dance aerobics and High Intensity Training. I felt it was better suited for High intensity training (lateral movements, forward and backward moves) versus dance aerobics (turns, quick pivots). The tongue on the shoe is thick which was a little uncomfortable as I did turns, I felt like the tongue edges hit me in the wrong spot and were not flexible.
customer_reviews.author: D.E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cross Trainer
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried about this shoe being to tight but it has been awesome and the fit has been perfect, I am a size 8 in sneakers. I also do multiple types of exercise including weight training and spinning and this has been a fantastic shoe for the different exercises. I have a wide foot and I have not even felt like I had that break-in experience they were comfortable from the Start. I never bought Puma brand but would definitely buy again and I also feel like the look of the shoe is a lot more beautiful in person then I expected. I thought they were black but it’s more like a dark grey.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Zingalie

customer_reviews.title: My feet hurt for days after wearing these once.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I'm returning these after wearing only once. First let me note that the sizing is off by 1/2 size. I've never had to buy a larger than 6 shoe like this previously. I bought a 6 based on the reviews that it's a true to size shoe... NOT!!! Also, my feet began to hurt within the hour of walking, but I could not change. This shoe fit as if it's defective. In any case, I don't like returning items, but this one... I can't work with.
customer_reviews.author: Tawanna Rock

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I like about this shoe is the color
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I like about this shoe is the color. It wasn't very comfortable and didn't help my feet any better than the cheaper sneakers from Payless. We buy a lot of Puma brand shoes and I was very disappointed in this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe. Fits as expected. Works for high-impact exercise.
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe. Fit as expected. I'm a solid 8.5 foot, and that's the size I ordered. I use these for cross-training (HIIT, plyo, weight-training) indoors on a tile floor (bummer on the tile, but it's what I have), so I need a pretty good shoe to cushion against the hard tile. I don't have any particular complaint about the shoe, the only reason I didn't give it a five star rating is because there's nothing super exceptional about them, they are good and they do the job and they were a good price.
customer_reviews.author: RaceMom

customer_reviews.title: Runs smaller than I am used to. Looks great though.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way these look. The memory foam had some divots in it from the tissue they stuff in the shoes. I think if I would have worn them for a while, it would have fixed itself, but it was something I noticed. I am usually a 6.5 or 7 in womens shoe (normal width). The 7 was snug and I was surprised that I would need a 7.5. Going to reorder and hope the new size works better. With all that said, it was still a good looking shoe!
customer_reviews.author: B Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Fit exactly to size
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes! The look, the fit, the feel, everything. I'm a size 10. Yes, women's LOL... Because these fit me like a glove, (I have slender feet)... I would suggest that if you have wider feet, to either buy a wide if they offer it or maybe go up a half size. Other than fitting exactly to your size, these cross trainers are heaven. I'm buying the grey ones next!!!! Get some!!
customer_reviews.author: TotallyVero

customer_reviews.title: No Support
customer_reviews.text: I attend a daily cross training class at my local gym and had read great reviews about this shoe. It appeared to be well made and I was excited to feel the foam cushion in the bottom. This shoe has a wide and stable base for cross training, however it is very flat with absolutely no support. My feet hurt after wearing them inside my house for a few hours. If you suffer any foot pain such as plantar fasciitis I do not recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Grodie

customer_reviews.title: ... to replace an old pair of Puma's that I loved. These shoes are comfortable however
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes to replace an old pair of Puma's that I loved. These shoes are comfortable however, are not made for working out/running or walking. There is essentially no arch support. There is a lip at the heel of this shoe where the cushion at the Achilles does not go to the bottom of the shoe. It stops half way. Due to this lip, I have giant blisters on the Achilles of both of my feet. I definitely would not suggest these shoes for avid walkers/runners.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnda D.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but runs small
customer_reviews.text: Size wise: I usually wear a 5.5, but ordered a 6 based on other people’s reviews that said they run a bit small. The 6 fit perfectly. The width is narrow compared to other shoes, but still fit me fine. I’m still breaking them in. They seem a little stiff, but hopefully will soften up. Good arch support. Overall, pretty comfortable. Good for walking on treadmill, but probably not good for running.
customer_reviews.author: BRM

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing insoles 😢
customer_reviews.text: I like the price, the fit and look of these shoes. I normally have to get a wide but I didn't and it fits fine. The first time I wore these to work I was loving them till about the 4th hour. The nice gel cushion was totally comfy and supportive and then it just... deflated, for lack of a better description. I used them a few more days in a row but that initial comfort that I was loving and had never experienced in new shoes before was gone. 😭😭😭😭 It's such a shame. I still wear them but will buy new insoles soon. They look great too. I have no issues with them outside of the insoles deflating.
customer_reviews.author: Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Like them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for work, not bad so far. They’re hard, the tiny thin memory foam isn’t amazing. But I have plantars Facsh so I have to put my custom insoles in them. My only problem is that my insoles make my heel slip off of them. I took the memory foam some out to give myself more room but then you just feel the glue at the bottom- not the shoes fault- I’m aware overall pretty good. I’m wearing them around the house some so that I can get them broke in because they’re a little stiff, but I can’t have mesh shoes because I cut hair and all the hair gets trapped in the mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCord

customer_reviews.title: Not a good shoe for working out especially if you have a narrow heel.
customer_reviews.text: I am sending these back. I have super narrow feet and the last time I bought Puma athletic shoes they were perfect, unfortunately that style was discontinued so I decided to try these. Horrible! Right out of the box I was instantly disappointed in the make of the shoe; instead of being supple the shoe is stiff and clunky and feels like a bowling shoe on your foot (looks like a golf shoe). The width was almost too tight while the heel area was too big causing the shoe to slide up and down the heel with such minimal movement that I didn’t bother trying them for workout.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shoe. I’ve been working out with them for over a month now (really wanted to test before leaving a review). I do weight training, HIIT training, dancing and basic cardio. These shoes work for everything I do. They took a few wears to break in around the ankles, but definitely not a big deal. They are very comfortable and really help my stability. These are absolutely worth it as they have worked great for me so far and you can feel that they are good quality. I would recommend especially since they aren’t outrageously expensive and seem like they will last for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Katie W.

customer_reviews.title: Downhill in the last five years
customer_reviews.text: I bought these exact shoes five years ago on a recommendation from nurses that they would work well for 12 hour shifts, which I was working at the time. They were really good shoes and they ended up lasting over five years, which considering the 12 hours shifts, is amazing. Eventually they needed to get replaced and I got these. The cushion on the inside is worse, not providing much comfort nor giving support. They're functional and I'll continue to wear them, but I doubt I'll buy this shoe again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon K.

customer_reviews.title: They look super cute but definitely not for the
customer_reviews.text: Way too stiff to do any workouts in. They look super cute but definitely not for the gym
customer_reviews.author: rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: Missed the return window as i didn't know about it.
customer_reviews.text: There's no room for my toes. I have a narrow foot and even though I read this in the reviews, I was hoping I would have a good fit. Unfortunately, that didn't happen. The shoes are nice looking but will not work for me. I was debating whether or not to keep them and time got away from me. I have just discovered that I cannot return them as I am ten days too late. The limit is 45 days. I did not see this anywhere when I ordered them. I am not pleased about this. I should think that maybe a gift card could be given if Amazon chooses to not give cash back. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Allen

customer_reviews.title: Has a very flat feel when walking.
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe, love the color and it's very stylish. I wore them to work, but my legs started hurting half way through my 10 hour shift. I can't wear them to work, but I definitely wear them to more social settings were I'm not doing so much walking. All and all I love the shoe and plan on buying more.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping for better
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning these shoes later today. I was hoping the reviews I read would be applicable to my situation, but they were not. The shoes were very stiff and rode up too high on my ankle causing some significant discomfort. They worked great lifting weights, but doing cardio was very uncomfortable. I had read reviews that they ran a little small so I ordered a wide width, but the wide width was too wide - I should have ordered my normal size. But since I have to return them for other reasons, the size is a mute point.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Slightly larger than usual
customer_reviews.text: Based on some reviews, I got 7.5W first, then I had to exchange with 7. I usually wear 7. Even 7 seems slightly too large as it feels like my heels are going to slide out. Once I tighten the laces, I know my feet are not going to slip out... I have been wearing boxing shoes for the most part, so the very cushy insole is something I have to get used to. I love the flexibility of boxing shoes, but I think I need a bit more cushion for circuit training due to some joint pains. I hope I won't regret keeping these.
customer_reviews.author: h a

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about ordering shoes online but I couldn't find any leather type tennis shoes that I liked in local stores. I can't wear fabric tops because I put holes in them quickly. I liked the black and pink so I ordered them. I have been wearing for a little while now and they are very comfortable! I love them! They fit exactly as I expected with plenty of room for my toes. The shoes look just like they did in the online picture. They are so cute and comfortable that I think I would buy a second pair! I definitely recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: dispalzz

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaks! Great fit and design
customer_reviews.text: This is the best design and fit pair of very comfortable activity sneakers I've owned since Junior High school! (That was 40 years ago). These are cushy but not sloppy soft, just right on every aspect. The way I judge shorts and sneakers when I get them is, I think to myself "Could I survive the Disney thing for 16 hours on a typical hot day in these? Still be comfortable and keep my parts clean?" If the answer is "yes" then it's a keeper. These sneakers are a "definitely yes!"
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: I sent them back, but so nice i will just order a differnt size.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for my daughter for Christmas. Ordered her regular size since she has already had her foot growth spurt for the year. They are REALLLLLY nice shoes. So sporty and clean. Unfortunately, as soon as I looked in them I instanly knew they were to small. They are narrow and the heal support is high and narrow too. I got her a size 6 in womens, her normal size. (Shes 11) Her foot is to wide for this shoes shape. I sent them back and will order 2 sizes up. Really gorgeous shoe, threads were nice and tight and all.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weight training shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love how solid these Puma Tazon 6 shoes are, perfect for weight training and CrossFit-type workouts! I love the stability, my foot doesn’t move around inside and the wider heel gives me such a great foundation for lifting. When I go to the gym for weight training, I wear my Pumas and do cardio on the elliptical, because these are definitely not running shoes. LOVE!!! *My ASICS are my “everyday” sneakers, and what I wear to run with our dogs around our neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: The Macks

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second time ordering this product because I was so happy the first time. I did accidentally order wide instead of regular but it still fits pretty well I actually have wide feet and the regular phones were a little tight but I just use that like support. Even though these are a little wider that was my fault but they still fit well last a long time and I get plenty of compliments on how pretty they are!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: The perfect cross trainer shoe
customer_reviews.text: I needed a kind of hard shoe for all my cardio impact moves with a good cushion insole and this was it. Here is a tip when ordering work out shoes, get it a half size bigger. Gives you plenty of room so your toes don't get crushed and you won't lose toe nails. Very happy with my purchase and would recommend this as a perfect workout shoe. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Arlo

customer_reviews.title: Like walking on clouds
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness I bought my actual size! These are true sizing so order the size you normally wear. I bought an 8.5 and they fit like a glove even with socks. I’m so impressed with how comfortable they are. The memory foam is awesome. It feels like I’m walking on clouds. Lots of all around support. My left heel usually hurts not with this shoe! Everything I want in a shoe. Don’t hesitate to buy this. They definitely get better once you break them in.
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I have a high arch and narrow heels. The puma shoes fit just right. They were comfortable from the beginning
customer_reviews.author: picky consumer

customer_reviews.title: Love the way they look, but not the way they feel.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get these. I love the way they look. The quality is great, I was pleased with how they were made. The toe area is way too narrow, and it doesn't feel like there's cushion or support in that area. After wearing for a bit, my feet were screaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, Comfortable and Cute PUMA Sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptic about getting myself some PUMA training sneaker because they are usually pretty narrow in the front and I have a fairly wide foot. Nonetheless, these sneakers are very comfortable. I've been using them for the past two weeks (walking and running) and I have no complaints. They look cute and sporty at the same time. I'm very satisfied with my purchase and would buy another pair in a different color whenever possible.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Díaz López

customer_reviews.title: Ouch. The rigid sides dig into my ankles.
customer_reviews.text: So if it fits, why does it get only 2 stars? I bought this shoe for kickboxing, strength training, and cardio war. All of these activities require quick lateral motion, something this shoe was supposed to be able to handle. Unfortunately the sides of the shoe are extremely rigid and dig into my ankles, making them painful to wear. I gave them 3 weeks but alas, no improvement at all. Into the give away box they go.
customer_reviews.author: AP1980

customer_reviews.title: Not for running!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes after reading lots of reviews online. These came very highly rated for weight lifting, running, cardio, etc. They are great for light cardio or arm days at the gym, but the arch support is way too high for leg day and these are AWFUL for running. If you want a super stiff and supportive shoe for something like kick-boxing, these are perfect. if you want something with flex, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Meowgi

customer_reviews.title: Great to Workout In
customer_reviews.text: Puma has become my favorite working out shoe. The size is a perfect fit (I'm a 9), the width and arch support are great. I lift weights, do timed exercises and run in them. So comfortable I can wear them all day. I get compliments on their looks too!
customer_reviews.author: ButterBean6536Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe meets all my expectations. I wore the shoes for 10 hours and my feet were not hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Etoy

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are a little stiff right out of the box, but I wore them for a long workout session without breaking them in and they were fine and did not give me blisters. They feel substantial. I normally buy athletic shoes 1/2 size bigger than dress shoes, and that was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Corolla Queen

customer_reviews.title: If you don’t want the $80+ running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped for a little more squish when running but they seem good for the price overall. I bought white because it was $15 less than other colors and so for the $48 or something I spent I’d say they’re good running shoes. Not necessarily on the $80+ quality side but that’s not what I paid. They’re cute. My knees didn’t hurt too bad after. They are very stiff shoes though, but almost like a solid foundation
customer_reviews.author: TheatreandFilm

customer_reviews.title: Heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I go to a "boutique gym" that is a little like CrossFit. There is plenty of high intensity movement. I found these shoes ok for weight lifting, but not for jumping, running, or shuffling - they really weighed me down. They also don't bend/flex very much, so doing anything on my toes (including planks) would cause toe cramps. It's a solid shoe, very sturdy, but not quite what I need for my workout routine.
customer_reviews.author: salodo

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Shoe/Snug Fit
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is attractive and gives support but no thick socks can be worn. This shoe fits to the exact size that you select so I probably should have gotten an 8. I wear a 7.5 with my other shoes, including tennis shoes but this is shoe is a little snug, not tight but snug. Not to the point of discomfort but you know you have the show on your foot. The real test will be when I walk around my neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive, but come up a little high around the ankles
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for high-impact dance classes. They are great BUT the sides near the ankle come up very high, so I've developed some tenderness where they press into the skin as I move. It may just be my feet. Otherwise, these shoes provide GREAT support (they're quite "high" off the ground if that makes sense) and really supports the foot when you're moving, preventing you from rolling your ankle or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Terra_turtle

customer_reviews.title: The material doesn’t allow for movement
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are cute and a great price but I only wore them a couple of times, then bought a new pair. The problem is that they are very stiff, so if you do a lot of jumping or HIIT it hurts your foot. The hard plastic digs into the top of the foot when you bend it too much. So it doesn’t allow for a lot of movement. Anyway, overall not a bad shoe if you’re not doing that type of exercise but didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: VLAg2009

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Stylish but buy bigger size
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is comfy and looks stylish. Based other persons reviews the shoe has a narrow fit so I had to go up in size. I normally wear 7.5. Some reviewers said go up a half and others said a full. I went up a full size and purchased a 8.5. Its a little big but the 8 would have been tight. So I don't regret my choice
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Felt cheap, stiff, and lack support
customer_reviews.text: These looked the closest to a replacement for a great pair of Pumas I had last year, which seem to be discontinued. But when I got them, they were nothing like them. They are very inflexible and felt kind of hard and plasticky on my feet. They also offer little arch support, which is important for me as I have high arches. Overall, they just felt rather cheap and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JBear

customer_reviews.title: I Hate Tennis Shoes but Love These
customer_reviews.text: If I could I would be barefoot 24/7 but at my age and with four dogs (lots of toys on the floor) it is not practical. I bought these to workout on my recumbent bike and to do aerobics. Normally when inside I can't lose my shoes fast enough but I find these are like walking on air and often prefer to keep them on. For the price I highly recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C. Muse

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE!!!!! I bought these for running... They have become my everyday shoe!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE!!!!! I bought these for running... They have become my everyday shoe! I've never been one to wear tennis shoes every day because they always look so awful, but these are sleek, fashionable, and extremely comfortable. I have very high arches in my feet, and these provide great support. The padding hasn't worn down any in the several months I've had them, and they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Janetta

customer_reviews.title: Too Stiff!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for cross-training, but I agree with all the negative reviews. While they have great lateral support, they are WAY too stiff--so stiff they hurt my ankles after trying them on for only a couple minutes. There's no way you could be in plantar flexion, run, or turn in these. I also thought they could have used more arch support.
customer_reviews.author: N & M C.

customer_reviews.title: Snug Fit
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these sneakers! For me the sneaker length runs fine but they are very snug fitting width wise. I have a shoe stretcher in them when Im not using, and just wearing them alittle at a time around the house for now, and hoping to stretch them enough to wear out. I really wanted the White with black stripe but can't seem to find any.
customer_reviews.author: Jacca

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable (once you break them in)
customer_reviews.text: I use these for aerobics and lifting and they give great side to side and front to back support. The ankle area was very stiff when I first got them (enough to give me bruises). However, once I broke them in, I really LOVE them. The uppers are really flexible and my foot feels good in them. The toe box is wide, so never any rubbing. And they are cute too!
customer_reviews.author: happybuyer

customer_reviews.title: I was going to order the wide width but they weren't available but the normal width fits fine. I have worn them for a couple hours ...
customer_reviews.text: Received my shoes today, I ordered a half size bigger than I normally wear based on other reviews. I was going to order the wide width but they weren't available but the normal width fits fine.I have worn them for a couple hours and so far they are very comfortable. I work a job where I am standing and walking 8 to 10 hours, so looking forward to seeing how they hold up and how they feel after wearing all day.
customer_reviews.author: bill allen

customer_reviews.title: Good and slightly bad?
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes...2nd week wearing them. The memory foam soles are not ideal because once they flatten after wearing them for a couple of days..the foot sinks in and now the edges hit my ankle bones..so I had to put in half a sole by the heel so my foot stays at the appropriate hight. The outside is sturdy but a little too much..the opening of the shoe is too stiff..hopefully it will soften with usage. Overall I like it..i work long shifts and needed the durability and the arch support (both great) byt that ankle issue got on my nerves tbh. Found a way around it tho. Idk if i would've bought it knowing that would be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Raneem

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am always hesitant to buy shoes online due to my foot structure. However, I’ve previously owned a pair of Puma shoes similar to these minus color and fabric so I proceeded with purchasing these. (The ones I previously owned were a different color and mesh on the toe box. These are mostly leather.) I have fairly narrow heels that frequently cause shoes to slip on my heels. So, if you have narrow heels you may want to expect to avoid thin socks while wearing these. Otherwise they fit as expected for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these I have ordered. I absolutely LOVE these shoes, they are super comfortable. I work 3rd shift and am on my feet for 8 plus hours 5 nights a week and these shoes are amazingly comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: LuvlyMomma

customer_reviews.title: Great for lifting and cardio
customer_reviews.text: I’m super pleased with these shoes. I’ve lifted and done cardio for 20 years, and usually buy really expensive shoes. These I found on a “best of” for 2018 cross trainers, and I’m very happy with them, especially for the price. These are well structured, keeping your foot protected and in place when doing any kind of gym work.
customer_reviews.author: jessicpack

customer_reviews.title: The best workout shoe I've ever tried!!
customer_reviews.text: Not only do these shoes look great, but I work out 2 &1/2 hrs each day. Still in perfect condition. Order a half size up because they do run small & are stiff at 1st, but the stiffness in the shoe only lasted 2 days. Excellent stability & support for feet & ankle. Improved my balance while speed walking! Definitely the very best, by far, over all the other shoes I tried (6 different shoes & brands that I ended up returning all of because of various issues in the last 8 months).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit with my custom orthotics
customer_reviews.text: I liked these shoes but they didn't fit with my orthotics in them so I had to return them. The heel was pushed too high and my feet felt like they were about to slip out with every step. The search for a good cross trainer workout shoe that will fit my custom orthotics continues. Brooks used to work, not anymore. Same with New Balance...
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I use them for gym workouts and classes. They feel very stable but without feeling like the sole is extended. Flatter than my running/walking shoes, in a good way. I usually wear an 8, sometimes an 8.5, especially in athletic shoes -- these were definitely better in 8.5 for me. These were on sale for a good price when I got them, and I ordered a much more expensive pair of running shoes at the same time. I like the running shoes pretty well, but I love the Pumas (my first pair ever). Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Great stability!!! Great fit!  Great look!  Happy Feet!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These are great! So comfortable and offers great support. I’m recovering from a broken 5th metatarsal. No more boot and crutches but still need support and advised to wear sneakers. The sneakers I had didn’t offer much stability. These are PERFECT!!! True to size and medium width. I love them. Would love to have them in white. Great price too when I got, the price has increased I just a couple days. Probably supply and demand.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe for Jazzercise
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe based upon ratings I saw through a Google search. My feet have taken a beating from years of running and aerobic exercise. I needed something with side to side stability, cushioning and support. This shoe meets most of these requirements. The toe box is a little tight on my foot but I think it's not the shoes fault. I think I need something with a mesh upper rather than a more rigid material like this shoe's upper. It has the stability and fits well but the arch support was insufficient for my foot. I bought a full length orthotic to replace the existing shoe liner and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Rita O.

customer_reviews.title: Cute shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are really comfortable, and I love the pink accents, even though I may replace the pink laces with black ones, but that's just because I just like a little more toned down shoe. The only reason I only gave them 4 stars is the sides under my ankle are a little high, so they rub a little. My last pair of Puma's are a little more low profile (and probably a different style), which I prefer. But other than that, they are really cute.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Thiel

customer_reviews.title: Nice stride and many compliments
customer_reviews.text: I like the subtle pink color with the black base. The sole outline where the arch area is molded in and upward, is very stylish. The fit was perfect as I have a picky 11 Medium foot, where sometimes I have to choose 11.5 instead. I was able to stay with the 11 size. Used during my workout at the gym with my trainer, and it had great stability and I could job/run on treadmill without gripping too much.
customer_reviews.author: T Bill

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable sneaker I’ve ever worn
customer_reviews.text: This show shocked me with how wonderful it fit and feels. It’s currently my favorite shoe and I’ve been a Nike person for years! I normally have to put arch supports in—not with these guys! The only downside is that because it’s not mesh (which is fabulous, it doesn’t rip or stretch too much that way) it is also hotter than some other shoes I’ve had. Still my favorite and I’ll probably buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my feet something horrible!!
customer_reviews.text: The most uncomfortable shoes I've EVER worn. The one and only time I have worn these was to the gym for a couple hours and the bottoms of my HURT!! And to be honest for several days after wearing these shoes my feat still hurt. They are super cute and for some people they may be the most comfortable shoes ever, but I sadly returned these.
customer_reviews.author: anitaj

customer_reviews.title: Fit slightly small but width is true to size
customer_reviews.text: Shoe feels very comfortable but unfortunately fit too small on me. Seems to run slightly small length wise because size 6.5 felt more like size 6.25 if such a size existed. The width felt true to size. I have wide feet and I tried the regular width because some other review mentioned a wide toe box. Unfortunately I don’t feel the regular toe box is wide enough. I’m sending these back to try the wide width version.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely won't purchase again!!
customer_reviews.text: Seem to fit okay at first but after wearing them for a few hours, I could definitely tell the right shoe was a lot narrower and started to cut off the circulation to my foot and dig into the top of my foot as well as my toes. Sent an email to the company but never hear back and it's been several month. Definitely won't purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable and super cute. I wear them to the gym mostly and have been happy with the purchase. The only negative, very minor, I've found that I can wear these for hours doing normal stuff like walks etc but if you are an elliptical junkie then after about 30 to 40 minutes I notice the sole of my feet near the toes feels kind of raw. Overall, still very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Most uncomfortable shoes I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: The inner sole says "soft foam" but it's not remotely soft. Feels like the soles of shoes you'd buy for $5 at Dollar General. The shoe is very stiff and presses into my ankle really hard. I tried wearing them around to break them in but all I accomplished was making my feet hurt terribly. You should not buy these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Pretty shoe!  But,...
customer_reviews.text: It's a very pretty shoe. BUT,... The memory foam is just a bad idea in a shoe... Once that is pressed down by the weight of your foot, as all memory foam does, it gets hard. So, wish they'd do away with that. For cross-training, you need good cushion. Memory foam is just not the right thing for that. Also,it's all leather-like all over, it's not very breathable. So, my foot sweats more in this shoe than in others.. All in all, I'm going to wear them because I bought them. But, probably wouldn't purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: tshaver

customer_reviews.title: Good HIIT shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when I started a new HIIT boot camp class. I normally only wear New Balance but took chance on these. They are good for working out. The arch support is not that great, so I would grab an insole. Not much cushion in the toe box, but the heel has cushion. Not sure I would buy them again, but I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joleen Nordstrom Is Me

customer_reviews.title: runs small
customer_reviews.text: It's a great looking shoe and has very good stability and arch support for the right foot. However, I usually take a 6 or 6-1/2. I ordered a 6-1/2 to be safe and the shoe was still pretty tight, especially around the toe box. My right foot literally went numb after wearing the shoe for 10 minutes. If you have a narrow foot, tend to overpronate and need the stability, then this is a good shoe, but order up a size.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Greenan

customer_reviews.title: 5 thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: Twice I ordered this same shoe and twice I was sent the wrong size the first time they were too big. The second pair was too small. Thanks amazon for making me look like i dont know how to buy the right size shoe. The worst parts is that Amazon's unwillingness to make it right to ahow they value its customers. Truly disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for strength training
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of these shoes. I use them for strength training and the work well for the cardio portions too. They fit true to size. I have plenty of room in the toes and width. For cross training they feel just as soft and supportive as running shoes. And they look great. On my first pair I was a little nervous the material would be too hot. Not a problem at all. Puma shoes are also priced well for great quality shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Renee R

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit comfortably whether you're 10 or 15 (we purchased two pairs)
customer_reviews.text: Horrible shoe, and I’m referring to the second shoe we received in replacement of the odd looking first shoe. The shoe is extremely small, for example, if you would wear a pair of those thick fuzzy SHERPAwinter socks with your shoes. Both pairs that I purchased were absolutely horrible!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MomOf6+InTx

customer_reviews.title: PUMA Sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I really like these sneakers. They are comfortable. The only problem I've encountered is the back of the sneaker. It scratches the back of my foot/achilles heel. The fabric rubs it and I have gotten a blister. I had to place a covering over the fabric to protect the back of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: Cute shoes, I wanted them to use on treadmill, not much arch support and toe box is bigger than I thought. The biggest problem is when you walk the top part of the tor box wrinkles and digs in to your toes as your foot flexes which hurts. I guess since the shoes are kinda plastic/hard material they don't flex properly.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Great workout and every shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these from hubby’s account because I needed some new shoes because I’ve been working out twice a day five days a week since August. I love these. They fit perfectly, give great arch support and can handle working out on treadmill, outdoor walking and weight training. The memory foam insoles are very comfortable. I highly recommend these Puma’s.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Support for ankles!
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and fit true to size, I like the arch support, and I tend to sprain my ankle now and then and concluded I need to buy shoes with better ankle support and these really give me more confidence plus they look cute too. They are also very comfortable. Good price for a decent shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin M.

customer_reviews.title: Supportable/Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have pronating issues, especially when exercising or running. I bought these all leather shoes for stability. They work great for aerobics/kick boxing, running, and regular exercising (lifting weights). I'm so thankful I took a chance on these. I bought a size 9 which is what I wear in all shoes. The only negative, my feet get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great for all day wear
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought pumas for work. I’m a nurse so I’m on my feet a lot! Love the room in the toe in this style. I don’t need arch support so no issues there but I don’t feel like there’s a ton of support in that area. They are beautiful and comfortable. My favorite work shoes currently.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Overall pleased
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes for dance fitness and am pleased, in general, with them. They are stiffer than other PUMA shoes that I own, which I don't prefer. The fit otherwise is fine and they feel supportive. Cushioning is moderately good, but I likely won't purchase them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Profplaydoe

customer_reviews.title: I'm sold!
customer_reviews.text: Being on my feet all day long, i was needing some good shoes with amazing support. I have bone spurs in heels , making it nearly impossible to walk first thing of a morning. Ive never worn pumas, but ran across these cuz they was cute( even my boyfriend made a comment) ..and the price was great. I never buy shoes online cuz im picky, they must look and fit right. I tried these on after the fast shipping and i was sold. I came bck to check for other colors available and felt this item was a great reason to write a review. Plan on buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Capps

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love the colors! I am an adult woman and will sometimes purchase kids shoes since they tend to be cuter. However the problem I usually have is they are too flat and no support. I was pleasantly surprised with these. They fit just like an adult woman shoe and comfortable. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am forever sold on these YUMAS
customer_reviews.text: Oh. My. God. These shoes have changed my life. I am recommending them to everyone I know. I absolutely love them. They are cross trainers. You can do anything in the shoes. They make me want to work out. They are very firm shoes with exceptional stability and support and they look freaking awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Frank

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and clumsy
customer_reviews.text: So I workout a lot. A variety of workouts (HIIT, Zumba, kickboxing, body pump, step, etc) These had great shock absorption and my back never hurt after my workout! However they were very stiff and did not allow for flexibility in my workouts that require agility. I felt clumsy and tripped several times. So they are not the shoe for agility workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan and Stina

customer_reviews.title: Great Kicks
customer_reviews.text: This is the very first time I bought a pair of PUMA sneakers. I LOVE them! I have such a hard time finding shoes that fit right... even when I go to the store to try them on. I was taking a chance ordering online but they fit perfectly!!! I usually buy NIKES because it is the only shoe I found that fits right. They are too expensive!!! PUMAS are much more reasonably priced and you get a good quality shoe. This particular pair of PUMAS are so comfortable with the soft, supportive insoles. They look sharp, too! I woukd definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Ingram

product_meta.title: PUMA Women's Tazon 6 WN's FM Cross-Trainer Shoe
product_meta.description:
A sleek, streamlined silhouette sets the PUMA tazon 6 shoe apart from the rest. This stylish sneaker sports a synthetic leather upper with midfoot saddle for maximum fit and comfort while eva in the heel absorbs impact.

PUMA is the global athletic brand that successfully fuses influences from sport, lifestyle and fashion. PUMA's unique industry perspective delivers the unexpected in sport-lifestyle footwear, apparel and accessories, through technical innovation and revolutionary design.
feature_bullets: Breathable EcoOrthoLite sockliner for optimum fit and comfort
